answers.answer: The baby is full term at 38 weeks and shouldn't have any problems. I would discuss this with your doctor. Dont be afraid to ask questions
Also baby can still turn to head down position.
Thanks Hannah. My obg is very consistent on doing at 38 w 1 d, whereas I m ready to stay till 39 w. I m confused to decide if it makes any difference 38 w vs 39 weeks..

With ur gd it might be the size and health of ur baby I delivered at 38.3 going to be induced then next day I also had gd and she was 9.6lbs if ur baby is big it can be risky to keep it in there! Ask ur doc these questions that's what there for!!!! And ur baby still has time to move ur only 30 weeks u have at least 8 togo unless ur water breaks or something in between and it's always ir choice on any kind of induction or c section date! Don't let them bully u but definitely ask why????

I am 29 weeks, have gestational diabetes and my baby is baby is still transverse as well. It's my understanding the induction maybe necessary,  due to the hormones in the placenta because of the gestational diabetes causing the baby to have low blood sugar after it's born.

question: Hi there..I m detected with gestational diabetic at 30 weeks pregnant and all of sudden my baby got into transverse position. My obg has planned a c sec on 38th week n 1 day. I m lil worried, is it absolutely necessary to wait for a week and plan c sec in 39th week? What are disadvantages for delivering on 38th w 1 d?
title: Gestation diabetes and baby lying transverse
